feat():Add authentication, health, metrics, and infrastructure modules

Introduces authentication use cases (login, logout, register, refresh token, verify email), domain entities and interfaces, infrastructure services (hashing, JWT, logging), and persistence layers. Adds health and metrics modules, updates environment configuration and scripts, and enhances .gitignore. Updates dependencies and adds support for rate limiting, logging, and monitoring.

Add global API response formatting and refactor config

Introduces a global ResponseInterceptor and ApiResponseDto for consistent API responses. Refactors health check endpoint, improves error handling and logging, and updates configuration to remove default values in favor of environment-based settings. Also updates mail and JWT services to use environment variables directly, and cleans up controller responses for uniformity.

Add Vercel serverless entrypoint and config

Introduces an API entrypoint using NestJS with Express for Vercel serverless deployment. Adds vercel.json to configure build and routing for the new API handler.

Right now there is no way for the user to specify the sink track the CL item should go on right now. So it always goes to the default one.

pull_request.title: Feat modify sink points
pull_request.body:
This feature makes it possible to add sink points to CL created items, as well as a limited ability to modify them. 
Modifying sink points of vanilla items always works, but modification of modded items is dependent on the load order. Mod items (and sink DT overrides) loaded before CL are not affected and I have not found a way around that. 

BP implementation is only in CL_InitWorld in the Init phase. (CL_items_module only had some now removed logging)

Credit to Th3Fanbus and his Th3RecipeMod for providing a nice c++ code template.

commits.message:
Remove obsolete Firefox preferences for testing

The following preferences don't have to be set manually anymore:

- `print.show_print_progress`
  - Why: removed
  - Bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1770536
  - Commit: https://github.com/mozilla-firefox/firefox/commit/b5226643104eb610ad2b0477a1a5fc6df0aeb65b

- `gfx.offscreencanvas.enabled`
  - Why: removed
  - Bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1914083
  - Commit: https://github.com/mozilla-firefox/firefox/commit/7d2c6889202d9fbf6133a30b27bcd07bc06cb107

- `layout.css.round.enabled`
  - Why: removed
  - Bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1874633
  - Commit: https://github.com/mozilla-firefox/firefox/commit/97909653e70cdf75b4e3669e178ec7fca6e98110

- `dom.events.asyncClipboard.clipboardItem`
  - Why: enabled by default
  - Bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1887845
  - Commit: https://github.com/mozilla-firefox/firefox/commit/de56ae88bf17f74207c40a627be93ccf1bcd2df6

Disable AI/ML features using Firefox preferences for testing

We don't need AI/ML features in the tests, so this should reduce CPU
usage by not having the inference process running. Moreover, it prevents
the following lines from being logged in the test output:

```
JavaScript error: resource://gre/actors/MLEngineParent.sys.mjs, line 509: Error: Unable to get the ML engine from Remote Settings.
JavaScript error: resource://gre/actors/MLEngineParent.sys.mjs, line 1279: TypeError: can't access property "postMessage", this[#port] is null
```

Merge pull request #20171 from timvandermeij/firefox-test-prefs

issue.title: Icon error
issue.body: When trying to use the icon creation script for Linux MX, the .png image is generated, but grub does not recognize it, but if I rename an image that was already generated in the repository, grub recognizes it normally.

comment.body:
Thanks, I've found the issue.
Apparently, GRUB cannot read the images when they are in Grayscale colorspace.

I've adjusted the icon generator script on the `dev` branch, so check that out and it should work!

I also never noticed that other icons like the generic GNU/Linux fallback icon were never displayed, because it too was automatically set to grayscale. They also work now, thanks for the heads up!

Update event_summary_beta.yaml

Removed leading zeros from 12-hour time.
Added "See Snapshot" Action

Update event summary blueprint to v1.5.1

Renames 'Remember' to 'Store in Timeline' and sets its default to true. Increases max_frames limit, removes temperature parameter, and adds 'Snapshot with Multiple Cameras' notification mode. Updates notification time formatting, improves image exposure logic, and adds action button to notifications. General code cleanup and version bump.

Update notification image to use camera entity_id

Changed the notification image field from using the snapshot file path to referencing the camera entity_id.

Use camera_message for notification text

Fixed Camera Name in Notification Message

Remove iOS notification attachment from event summary

Eliminated the 'attachment' field from the iOS notification action in event_summary_beta.yaml.

Remove duplicate 12 Hour time format entry

Eliminated a redundant '12 Hour' value in the event_summary_beta.yaml

Update preview mode options and descriptions

Replaces 'Snapshot with Multiple Cameras' with 'Live Preview with Multiple Cameras' in preview mode options and related logic. Updates the description to clarify Android notification behavior and corrects conditions and image exposure logic accordingly.

Improve notification delivery and preview mode logic

Enhanced the notification delivery and preview mode descriptions for clarity, specifying platform differences and known bugs. Updated the action logic to handle 'Snapshot' and 'Live Preview' modes separately, ensuring correct notification behavior based on user selection.

Add analysis_mode option to notification settings

Introduces a new 'analysis_mode' input to allow users to select between 'Snapshot' and 'Live Preview' for event notifications after analysis. Updates the notification delivery and preview mode descriptions for clarity, and adjusts logic to use 'analysis_mode' for post-analysis notification updates.

Improve descriptions and formatting in blueprint YAML

Enhanced the descriptions for preview_mode, analysis_mode, and tts_volume options with clearer formatting, notes, and important warnings.

Clarify Android snapshot bug note in blueprint

Reworded the bug note for Android snapshot behavior to improve clarity regarding notifications when using multiple camera entities.

Update camera snapshot bug note in blueprint

Clarified the bug description regarding camera snapshots in notifications, specifying recommended options for Android and iOS users.

pull_request.title: Adding a ResourceManager
pull_request.body: This PR leverages the resource primitive from MCPServers and introduces a new ResourceManager to enable using resources within the application. The core idea of resources is to enable pulling data/information based on the paths and references provided by the MCPServer. We extended it primarily in our client to enable referencing it as context for LLM to use when referenced by the user but can be extended to other app functionalities as well. We also add functionality to reference resources in the webui using `@` for MCPServers that do expose resources. ## Summary by CodeRabbit - New Features - Introduced unified resource management across app, including listing, reading, and existence checks. - Added REST API endpoints to browse resources and fetch content, including per-server views. - Added CLI ‚Äúresources‚Äù command (supports --read, --json, --strict, and agent path). - Enabled @-triggered resource autocomplete in the web UI input, with filtering and keyboard navigation. - Messages now expand @ resource references into formatted content before sending. - Documentation - Updated CLI help with guidance on using @ references and the new resources command. - Tests - Added comprehensive tests for resource parsing, providers, and manager; updated lifecycle tests.

This mock represents a custom provider resource but sets source: 'mcp'. It should be 'custom' to reflect the URI prefix and expected shape.

             uri: 'custom--provider1--custom://resource',

pull_request.title: Refactor
pull_request.body:
## Description

This pull request introduces a foundational and comprehensive architectural refactoring of the Khora Engine. The primary goal is to move from an initial, monolithic proof-of-concept in a single `khora_engine_core` crate to a fully decoupled, multi-crate workspace that implements the **CLAD (Control-Lane-Agent-Data)** architecture.

This change is a prerequisite for implementing the engine's core SAA (Symbiotic Adaptive Architecture) features. It establishes clear boundaries and responsibilities between different layers of the engine, ensuring modularity, testability, and long-term maintainability.

The key changes include:
*   **Decomposition:** The original crate has been broken down into several new, purpose-driven crates: `khora-core`, `khora-data`, `khora-infra`, `khora-telemetry`, and `khora-sdk`.
*   **Abstraction:** Core functionalities like windowing, rendering, and memory management are now defined by abstract traits in `khora-core`, with concrete implementations (Winit, WGPU) moved into `khora-infra`.
*   **Composition Root:** A new `khora-sdk` crate has been introduced to act as the public-facing API and "composition root," assembling the various components into a functional engine. The `sandbox` example is now a simple client of this SDK.
*   **Synchronization Fixes:** Several complex, low-level race conditions and shutdown errors related to the WGPU GPU profiler and event loop have been diagnosed and fixed, resulting in a stable application lifecycle.

This refactoring touches nearly every part of the existing codebase to establish a solid foundation for all future development.

*   Implements #116 (by creating a full platform abstraction with the `KhoraWindow` trait)
*   Fixes several un-filed runtime bugs related to GPU synchronization and application shutdown.

## Type of change

Please check the boxes that apply or delete options that are not relevant.

- [ ] **Bug fix** (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] **New feature** (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [x] **Breaking change** (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [x] **Documentation update**
- [x] **Refactoring / Performance improvements**
- [x] **Build system / CI improvements**
- [ ] **Other** (please describe):

## How Has This Been Tested?

This change has been tested at multiple levels, moving from individual component validation to full application integration.

- [x] All existing unit tests have been migrated to their new crates and pass successfully.
- [x] All crates in the new workspace compile cleanly without warnings using `cargo check --workspace` and `cargo clippy --workspace --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings`.
- [x] Manual testing performed as described below:
    *   Step 1: Run the `sandbox` application using `cargo run -p sandbox` with `RUST_LOG=info`.
    *   Step 2: Observe the console output for successful initialization of all systems (window, renderer, telemetry).
    *   Step 3: Confirm that the application window appears with a colored background.

- No control actions found in Step 2 results
- No hazards found in Step 1 results

issue.body:
This change depends on
https://invent.kde.org/frameworks/kirigami/-/merge_requests/1795, which is released, but the Frameworks version containing it isn't yet in the KDE Runtime. We missed this at build-time because the Frameworks dependency version was not updated in CMake when the merge request was merged for NeoChat.

Fixes https://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=508298
